publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-1717# Irene Oldfather: Carrick-City of Adelaide—That the Parliament welcomes North Ayrshire Council’s refusal of permission to demolish the Carrick-City of Adelaide, the world’s oldest composite ship and the only vessel in Scotland to be an "A" listed structure; supports the efforts being made to secure funding for repairs and renovation, and calls upon all relevant agencies to ensure that this historically important vessel is retained and restored for future generations.
S1M-1717# Carrick-City of Adelaide (lodged on 5 March 2001) Mr Murray Tosh*, Mr Kenneth Gibson*
S1M-1717# Carrick-City of Adelaide (lodged on 5 March 2001) Michael Russell*

S1M-1717# Irene Oldfather: Carrick-City of Adelaide—That the Parliament welcomes North Ayrshire Council’s refusal of permission to demolish the Carrick-City of Adelaide, the world’s oldest composite ship and the only vessel in Scotland to be an "A" listed structure; supports the efforts being made to secure funding for repairs and renovation, and calls upon all relevant agencies to ensure that this historically important vessel is retained and restored for future generations. Supported by: Mr Murray Tosh, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Michael Russell
S1M-1717# Carrick-City of Adelaide (lodged on 5 March 2001) Kay Ullrich*, Tricia Marwick*
S1M-1717# Carrick-City of Adelaide (lodged on 5 March 2001) Robin Harper*, Ms Sandra White*
S1M-1717# Carrick-City of Adelaide (lodged on 5 March 2001) Mr Gil Paterson*

S1M-1717# Irene Oldfather: Carrick-City of Adelaide—That the Parliament welcomes North Ayrshire Council’s refusal of permission to demolish the Carrick-City of Adelaide, the world’s oldest composite ship and the only vessel in Scotland to be an "A" listed structure; supports the efforts being made to secure funding for repairs and renovation, and calls upon all relevant agencies to ensure that this historically important vessel is retained and restored for future generations. Supported by: Mr Murray Tosh, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Michael Russell, Kay Ullrich, Tricia Marwick, Robin Harper, Ms Sandra White, Mr Gil Paterson
S1M-1717# Carrick-City of Adelaide (lodged on 5 March 2001) Donald Gorrie*, Andrew Wilson*

S1M-1717# Irene Oldfather: Carrick-City of Adelaide—That the Parliament welcomes North Ayrshire Council’s refusal of permission to demolish the Carrick-City of Adelaide, the world’s oldest composite ship and the only vessel in Scotland to be an "A" listed structure; supports the efforts being made to secure funding for repairs and renovation, and calls upon all relevant agencies to ensure that this historically important vessel is retained and restored for future generations. Supported by: Mr Murray Tosh, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Michael Russell, Kay Ullrich, Tricia Marwick, Robin Harper, Ms Sandra White, Mr Gil Paterson, Donald Gorrie, Andrew Wilson
S1M-1717# Carrick-City of Adelaide (lodged on 5 March 2001) Rhoda Grant*
S1M-1717# Carrick-City of Adelaide (lodged on 5 March 2001) Mr David Davidson*

S1M-1717# Irene Oldfather: Carrick-City of Adelaide—That the Parliament welcomes North Ayrshire Council’s refusal of permission to demolish the Carrick-City of Adelaide, the world’s oldest composite ship and the only vessel in Scotland to be an "A" listed structure; supports the efforts being made to secure funding for repairs and renovation, and calls upon all relevant agencies to ensure that this historically important vessel is retained and restored for future generations. Supported by: Mr Murray Tosh, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Michael Russell, Kay Ullrich, Tricia Marwick, Robin Harper, Ms Sandra White, Mr Gil Paterson, Donald Gorrie, Andrew Wilson, Rhoda Grant, Mr David Davidson
